title: Pressure Plates
summaries: Pressure Plates are activation mechanisms that trigger wired mechanisms when stepped on. A pressure plate's color determines which characters can trigger it.

Pressure plates can be purchased from a <linked>Mechanic</linked> or taken from a natural source since the Red, Brown, Gray, Orange and Lihzahrd pressure plates are randomly generated on the map during world creation as the trigger for <linked>traps</linked>. Pressure plates only take up very small space on top of <linked>blocks</linked>, so they may be difficult to spot. The color of naturally spawned pressure plates is dependent on the color of the block it is generated on top of. They should be approached with caution as each one is (usually) connected to a <linked>trap</linked> mechanism.

The <linked>Mechanic</linked> sells all types, except for <linked>Lihzahrd</linked> Pressure Plates, which have their distinct color of brown to blend in with <linked>Lihzahrd Bricks</linked>, and the Weighted Pressure Plates, which are crafted.

The Teal Pressure Pad is a special kind of pressure plate that responds to projectiles impacting it and from pets touching it. Unlike regular pressure plates, the Teal Pressure Pad can be placed on the floor, ceiling, or sidewall, but not on platforms.

Weighted Pressure Plates activate once on being depressed, and again on being released. Weighted Pressure Plates of the same color share a single state. As long as one Weighted Pressure Plate of a given color is already pressed down within a circuit, stepping on another identical plate will not send a new signal.

Activates when a player steps on or off it (Weighted)
